channel.title: VBoxHardenedLoader
channel.description:
Hello developers. Question - is [VBoxHardenedLoader](https://github.com/hfiref0x/VBoxHardenedLoader) compatible with Whonix?
VBoxHardenedLoader is completely incompatible with Whonix, any change in accordance with the instructions will violate anonymity. VBoxHardenedLoader is fully compatible with Whonix, any change in accordance with the instructions is possible, anonymity will not be violated. VBoxHardenedLoader is partially compatible with Whonix, if you make only some changes, other changes in accordance with the instructions will violate anonymity.
Thanks in advance for the reply.

item.title: VBoxHardenedLoader
item.dc:creator: 0x1f
item.description:
I highly recommend you do not use it.
if Virtualbox does not provide you sufficient protection, you should look at other hypervisors, or you could run Qubes-Whonix.

Read full topic

item.title: VBoxHardenedLoader
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
github.com/hfiref0x/VBoxHardenedLoader

Hardened Malloc

opened 01:05PM - 12 Oct 21 UTC
adrelanos

Hardened Malloc might be useful to harden VirtualBox. Due to [`VirtualBox crashe…s with hardened memory allocator Hardened Malloc on the host`](https://www.virtualbox.org/ticket/20107) it's hints at some memory corruption bug. Mentioning this since you seem to be interested in hardening VirtualBox while upstream virtualbox.org doesn't seem to care about this.

Read full topic

item.description:
numeroustranslate:

Hello developers. Question - is VBoxHardenedLoader compatible with Whonix?

Whonix – 13 Sep 21

Undocumented, Untested or Unsupported Features

This feature is either undocumented, untested, or unsupported. Options: Become a Contributor / Apply Free Support Principle / Purchase Professional Support.

Read full topic
